Package me.bristermitten.mittenlib.config.provider

Class FileWatchingConfigProvider<T>

java.lang.Object
me.bristermitten.mittenlib.config.provider.FileWatchingConfigProvider<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the config
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.inject.Provider<T>, ConfigProvider<T>, WrappingConfigProvider<T>
public class FileWatchingConfigProvider<T> extends Object implements ConfigProvider<T>, WrappingConfigProvider<T>
A ConfigProvider that watches a file for changes, reloading the config when the file changes

  • Constructor Details

    • FileWatchingConfigProvider

      public FileWatchingConfigProvider(CachingConfigProvider<T> delegate, FileWatcherService watcherService)
      Create a new FileWatchingConfigProvider
      Parameters:
      delegate - the delegate to watch. This must have a present ConfigProvider.path(), which indicates the file to watch.
      watcherService - the service to use to watch the file
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given delegate does not have a present ConfigProvider.path()

  • Method Details

    • get

      public T get()
      Specified by:
      get in interface javax.inject.Provider<T>

    • path

      public Optional<Path> path()
      Description copied from interface: ConfigProvider
      The path of the source for the config, if available

      This is not always required - if the config came from a URL or String, for example, then this would be expected to return an empty Optional

      However, if it is coming from the Filesystem (in most cases, it will), then a filled optional should be returned to allow things like FileWatchingConfigProvider

      Specified by:
      path in interface ConfigProvider<T>
      Returns:
      The path for of the config's source

    • clearCache

      public void clearCache()
      Description copied from interface: ConfigProvider
      Clear any and all cached config, if applicable. If this is a WrappingConfigProvider, then this method should also be called on the result of WrappingConfigProvider.getWrapped().

      This may be a no-op if the config is not cached.

      Specified by:
      clearCache in interface ConfigProvider<T>

    • getWrapped

      @NotNull public @NotNull ConfigProvider<T> getWrapped()
      Specified by:
      getWrapped in interface WrappingConfigProvider<T>
      Returns:
      the wrapped ConfigProvider
